item.title: Onion CEO Ben Collins Hasn't Given Up on Print—or Buying Infowars
item.description: A year after relaunching The Onion as a newspaper, Collins visits Uncanny Valley to talk about why “going into something and not ruining it is bravery.”

item.title: Onion CEO Ben Collins Hasn't Given Up on Print—or Buying Infowars
item.description: A year after relaunching The Onion as a newspaper, Collins visits Uncanny Valley to talk about why “going into something and not ruining it is bravery.”

item.title: The Destruction of NASA Would Be a Blow to Our Collective Imagination
item.description: As NASA grapples with major proposed budget cuts and losing some of its most brilliant minds, America’s willingness to look outward is also at risk.

item.title: The Destruction of NASA Would Be a Blow to Our Collective Imagination
item.description: As NASA grapples with major proposed budget cuts and losing some of its most brilliant minds, America’s willingness to look outward is also at risk.

item.title: A $17 Hotdog and a Humanoid Robot Serving Popcorn: WIRED's Day at the Tesla Diner
item.description: WIRED stopped by the new Tesla Diner in Hollywood to try a $17 hotdog, watch a humanoid robot serve popcorn, and talk to people who still stan Elon Musk.

item.title: A $17 Hotdog and a Humanoid Robot Serving Popcorn: WIRED's Day at the Tesla Diner

item.title: What’s Behind Gen Z’s Sex Recession?
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, author Carter Sherman breaks down the forces shaping Gen Z’s unique relationship to sex.
